articles.title: Google Sparks Backlash After Gmail Setting Lets Gemini Peek Inside Inboxes - Decrypt
articles.description: Google has faced criticism after a buried setting allowed Gemini to scan inboxes and calendars without clear notice to users.

articles.title: Hands On With Google's Nano Banana Pro Image Generator - wired.com
articles.description: Google’s latest AI image model is vastly better than the previous release at generating text in images. You can expect companies to go buck wild with this update.

articles.title: 75+ Black Friday deals at Best Buy that aren't cheaper anywhere else - Mashable
articles.description: Best Buy's official Black Friday sale started on Nov. 20, and you can find savings in every category.

articles.title: Destiny 2 Renegades launch trailer leaks early via YouTube ad ahead of developer livestream - The Game Post
articles.description: A new Destiny 2 Renegades launch trailer leak has appeared via a YouTube ad, giving us our first look at new story cinematics, characters, and Star Wars-style ships ahead of Bungie’s developer livestream.

articles.title: HP and Dell disable HEVC support built into their laptops’ CPUs - Ars Technica
articles.description: HEVC licensing gets more expensive in January.

articles.title: Google Launches Unauthorized Pixel-to-iPhone File Sharing With Apple’s AirDrop - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: Alphabet Inc.’s Google said it has developed a way for its latest Pixel smartphones to exchange images and other files with iPhones using Apple Inc.’s AirDrop protocol, a bold attempt to undermine the exclusivity of its rival’s closely guarded ecosystem.
